definition: to sing loudly/fig. to mouth slogans
loud songs reaches the clouds (idiom); fig. to praise to the skies

sentences.english: It s enough to get you singing Ai Wo Zhong-guo (I Love China).
sentences.chinese: 这就足以令你高唱“我爱中国”了。

sentences.english: On the grass, grasshoppers singing near by them with gi gi zi zi .
sentences.chinese: 草地上，唧唧织织的草蜢不时在旁和声高唱。

sentences.english: Rise the national flag. Sing the national song!
A crowd greeted him by waving palm branches and singing "Hosanna."
sentences.chinese: 人群挥舞着棕榈枝，高唱着“和散那”向他致敬。

sentences.english: They roared out a drinking song.
Swift the wings of angels singing alleluia.
sentences.chinese: 天使振翅高唱哈利路亚。

sentences.english: Now to the Lord sing praises.
These fireflies even twinkled with their friends of the same kind at the neighboring tree, singing in chorus.
sentences.chinese: 这些萤火虫也照亮了附近的树木，齐声高唱。

sentences.english: Tens of thousands of fans greeted the squad, chanting “we do not regret the love.”
sentences.chinese: 成千上万球迷前来迎接，齐声高唱“爱你无悔”。

sentences.english: Yet they are hardly singing the “Ode to Joy” in Europe’s boardrooms.
sentences.chinese: 然而欧洲企业的董事会绝不会高唱《欢乐颂》。

sentences.english: The rally finished up with the singing of the Internationale.
sentences.chinese: 大会最后以高唱《国际歌》结束。

sentences.english: A heart in tune with God can't help but sing His praise.
sentences.chinese: 人心若与上帝同调，怎能不高唱赞美歌？

sentences.english: She couldn't remember names, but she sang lots of hymns by heart.
sentences.chinese: 她记不起人名，但她能凭心里的记忆高唱大量圣诗。

sentences.english: The conference ended up with the singing of the Internationale.
sentences.chinese: 会议最后以高唱《国际歌》而结束。

sentences.english: And Picking Mulberry, or singing along.
sentences.chinese: 采桑子，高唱欢歌，谁也不知疲倦。

sentences.english: No more love songs, then, I have done with such.
sentences.chinese: 再没有情歌让我放声高唱。

definition: to sing loudly/to lift one's voice in song
to shout loudly/to raise a cry/to yell
to sing at the top of one's voice (idiom)
to sing the praises of/to extol/to eulogize
singing voice/fig. original voice of a poet
